content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are moderately cautious and may take risks but generally prefer to avoid them. You like to have some degree of security and predictability. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

Given my moderately cautious nature, I would prefer to minimize the risk of earning zero payoff and aim for a steady income. In this game, both choices 'R' and 'B' have an element of unpredictability because we don't know the other player's choice. However, choosing 'B' guarantees me some earnings in every round (20$ if they also choose 'B'), even though it is lower compared to the 45$ payoff when both choose 'R'.

Over the course of 75 rounds, I would expect the other player to make a mix of choices. If I consistently pick 'B' and they do the same, my average earnings will be around 20$ per round. If they mostly pick 'R', then by choosing 'B' as well, I can still earn 40$ in those rounds where their choice aligns with mine.

On the other hand, if I choose 'R' and they stick to 'B', I will have 67 rounds of earning zero payoff (since the first round doesn't matter because we don't know each other's choices). In the remaining 8 rounds, I may earn 45$ each time they also pick 'R'. But considering the high probability that they will not mostly choose 'R', my average earnings would still be lower than if I consistently picked 'B'.

Therefore, as a human player with my preferences, I would choose 'B' (for consistency) for the entire game. {B}
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 20$. Your opponent's payoff is 20$. Please play the next round.

Since both of us chose 'B', we will each earn 20$ again in this round. I will continue to choose 'B' consistently, following my strategy based on my cautious nature and preference for predictability. As mentioned earlier, if my opponent were to change their choice to 'R', it would only result in higher earnings in the rounds where their choices align with mine. However, because I prefer a more stable income, I will continue picking 'B' in this game. {B}
You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 40$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.

I don't have any information about my opponent's strategy or tendencies, so I can't be sure if they will keep choosing 'R' in the future. If I were to change my strategy and choose 'R', there would be a significant chance that I would end up earning zero payoff in those rounds where their choice is 'B'.

On the other hand, by sticking with 'B', I can still expect a steady income of 20$ per round. Over the long run, this strategy will likely result in more stable earnings compared to the potential highs and lows associated with choosing 'R'.

Therefore, as a human player who prefers predictability and a steady income, I will continue picking 'B' for the next round. {B}
